text: 1 minute review.
speaker: A

text: Assassins Creed three.
speaker: A

text: Ready?
speaker: A

text: Go.
speaker: A

text: It's good.
speaker: A

text: I like it quite a bit.
speaker: A

text: It actually feels like more like a franchise evolution instead of some sort of crappy expansion pack.
speaker: A

text: The new setting goes a long way to make the whole game feel a lot more fresh.
speaker: A

text: I really enjoy the new outdoors areas.
speaker: A

text: Some of them are really impressive in terms of scope and the freedom of movement you have through all the streets.
speaker: A

text: There are a lot of different things that you can do to keep you playing.
speaker: A

text: The hunting is really cool.
speaker: A

text: I really like the all new ship battles.
speaker: A

text: The online multiplayer is a decent distraction, but it's nothing that's going to hold your attention.
speaker: A

text: The improved graphics engine is very impressive.
speaker: A

text: It can hold a lot of characters on screen, even though they all look like they're wearing lip gloss.
speaker: A

text: The story is really good and there are a bunch of hidden items everywhere for you to find.
speaker: A

text: However, with all the fun things on the side, it takes a big focus away from one of the most important aspects the assassinations.
speaker: A

text: It's becoming less and less about finding your target and finding a way to approach them and then kill them.
speaker: A

text: There is still some of that in there, but it's not nearly as cool as it has been in the past.
speaker: A

text: But it still has great gameplay.
speaker: A

text: And most important importantly, it's absolutely worth your time and money.
speaker: A

text: And it's way better than Assassin's Creed revelations.
speaker: A

text: Assassin's Creed Three gets a score of an eight out of ten.
speaker: A
